definition[0]: if something bursts, or if you burst it, it breaks open or apart suddenly and violently so that its contents come out
example[0]: The pipes had burst and the house was under two feet of water.
definition[1]: to move somewhere suddenly or quickly, especially into or out of a place
definition[2]: the act of something bursting or the place where it has burst
example[2]: a burst in the water pipe
definition[3]: a short sudden effort or increase in activity
example[3]: The van gave a sudden burst of speed.
definition[4]: a short sudden and usually loud sound
example[4]: sharp bursts of machine gun fire
definition[5]: a sudden strong feeling or emotion
